snippet: A collection of Mughal sandstone partitions (which make eavesdropping a breeze), is on display at two galleries in London.
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; two London art galleries are displaying sandstone filigree partitions from 16th-century Mughal buildings in India; Newport Art Museum pays $24,000 for crayon drawing by painter George Bellows at Capo Auction in Long Island City; Lower East Side Tenement Museum has simulated an 1860s saloon that used to be on premises as part of long-term exhibition Shop Life.
lead_paragraph: A collection of Mughal sandstone partitions (which make eavesdropping a breeze), is on display at two galleries in London.

headline.seo: Mughal Jalis Shown in London; George Bellows Drawing Sold
headline.main: Poetry in Stone, From the 16th Century
headline.print_headline:
Poetry in Stone,
From the 16th Century
